result.reason: Putty window embedded in mRemoteNG loses its maximized/filled state after system resume because there is no handler for PowerModeChanged events to trigger a resize.
result.approach: 1. Add `OnPowerModeChanged` virtual method to `ProtocolBase`. 2. Listen to `SystemEvents.PowerModeChanged` in `FrmMain` and invoke the method on active connections. 3. Override `OnPowerModeChanged` in `PuttyBase` to call `Resize`, forcing the window to fill the container.
